questions.question: How many Bitcoin will ever exist (in millions)?
questions.hint: It's a famous number - the ultimate scarcity
questions.explanation: Only 21 million Bitcoin will ever exist due to the halving schedule and fixed supply cap.

questions.question: In what year was the Bitcoin Genesis Block mined?
questions.hint: This was during the financial crisis, embedded in the coinbase message
questions.explanation: January 3, 2009. Satoshi embedded 'The Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banks' in the genesis block.

questions.question: How many Bitcoin halvings have occurred as of 2025?
questions.hint: Last one was in 2024
questions.explanation: Halvings occurred in 2012, 2016, 2020, and 2024. The next will be around 2028.

questions.question: What percentage (approximately) of Bitcoin mining uses renewable energy?
questions.hint: More than half - Bitcoin miners chase cheap energy
questions.explanation: Studies estimate 50-60% of Bitcoin mining uses renewable energy, as miners seek the cheapest power sources globally.

questions.question: In what year did President Nixon end the Gold Standard?
questions.hint: Early 1970s - a pivotal moment in monetary history
questions.explanation: On August 15, 1971, Nixon closed the gold window, ending Bretton Woods and ushering in the pure fiat era.

questions.question: What is the annual inflation target for the Federal Reserve (in percent)?
questions.hint: It's a small single-digit number
questions.explanation: The Fed targets 2% annual inflation, meaning your money loses purchasing power by design. Bitcoin has zero inflation after all are mined.

questions.question: Approximately how many fiat currencies exist in the world today?
questions.hint: It's one of the orange pill numbers - think about UN member states
questions.explanation: There are approximately 180 fiat currencies globally, all subject to inflation and government control. Bitcoin is one.

questions.question: What was the approximate U.S. inflation rate (CPI) peak in 2022 (in percent)?
questions.hint: It was the highest in 40 years - a single digit
questions.explanation: U.S. inflation peaked around 9% in mid-2022, the highest since the early 1980s, driving Bitcoin interest as a hedge.

questions.question: What is the approximate average price in cents per kilowatt-hour (kWh) for electricity in the DMV area?
questions.hint: It's in the 10-20 cent range per kWh
questions.explanation: DMV electricity costs approximately 13-17 cents per kWh, varying by state and provider. This affects home mining profitability.

questions.question: How many kilowatt-hours (kWh) of renewable energy are needed to earn one SREC (Solar Renewable Energy Credit)?
questions.hint: It's a nice round number in the thousands
questions.explanation: 1,000 kWh (1 MWh) of solar energy generation earns one SREC, which can be sold to utilities meeting renewable portfolio standards.

questions.question: In what year does the Clean Energy DC Omnibus Act aim for 100% renewable energy supply?
questions.hint: It's in the 2030s, and happens to be a power of 2 times a significant Bitcoin number
questions.explanation: The Clean Energy DC Omnibus Act of 2018 sets a goal of 100% renewable electricity by 2032 for the District of Columbia.

questions.question: How many watts does a typical modern refrigerator use (average)?
questions.hint: Think 100-200 watts continuous
questions.explanation: Modern refrigerators use approximately 100-200 watts on average. Understanding power consumption helps evaluate Bitcoin mining energy use.

questions.question: What is the typical American household's average monthly electricity bill (in dollars)?
questions.hint: Think $100-$150 range
questions.explanation: The average U.S. household electricity bill is approximately $110-$140/month, varying by region and usage.

questions.question: How many minutes on average does it take to mine one Bitcoin block?
questions.hint: Think about Bitcoin's consistent heartbeat - it's a key design feature
questions.explanation: Bitcoin is designed to produce blocks every 10 minutes on average. This timing is maintained through difficulty adjustments every 2,016 blocks.

questions.question: How many satoshis are in one Bitcoin?
questions.hint: Think millions, but which kind?
questions.explanation: One Bitcoin equals 100,000,000 satoshis (100 million). A satoshi is the smallest unit of Bitcoin.

questions.question: How many electoral college votes are needed to win the U.S. presidency?
questions.hint: This number represents DMV's political power in the Nobody•Will•Pay distribution
questions.explanation: 270 electoral votes are required to win. This number symbolizes political power and appears throughout the Nobody•Will•Pay project.

questions.question: What is the standard port number for HTTPS encrypted web traffic?
questions.hint: It's on the green pill sign - think secure connections
questions.explanation: Port 443 is the standard for HTTPS (encrypted web traffic). Always check for HTTPS when entering wallet info!

questions.question: What is the most common HTTP status code for 'Not Found'?
questions.hint: It's a famous error code everyone has seen
questions.explanation: HTTP 404 means 'Not Found' - a page doesn't exist. It's internet culture at this point.

questions.question: How many bits are in an IPv4 address?
questions.hint: It's a multiple of 8, creates the familiar 4-part format
questions.explanation: IPv4 addresses are 32 bits (4 bytes), giving 4.3 billion possible addresses - not enough for Bitcoin's global scale!

questions.question: What is the standard port number for HTTP web traffic?
questions.hint: It's a two-digit number - super common
questions.explanation: Port 80 is the default for HTTP (unencrypted web traffic). HTTPS uses 443.

questions.question: In what year was Facebook (now Meta) founded?
questions.hint: Mid-2000s at Harvard
questions.explanation: Facebook launched in 2004, creating the social media era and centralized data collection Bitcoin resists.
